nodes.label: Relational Databases
nodes.title: Relational Databases: Relational databases store data in tables consisting of rows and columns, with each row representing a record and each column representing an attribute.

nodes.label: Physical database design: file and storage structures
nodes.title: Physical database design: file and storage structures: Delve into the physical design aspects of relational databases, including file organization, index structures, and storage optimization techniques to enhance performance and scalability.

nodes.label: Query Processing
nodes.title: Query Processing: Query processing involves translating a query expressed in SQL or a similar language into a sequence of operations that can be executed by the database system.

nodes.label: Index structures
nodes.title: Index structures: Index structures are data structures used to improve the efficiency of data retrieval operations, such as searching and sorting.

nodes.label: B+ trees
nodes.title: B+ trees: B+ trees are balanced tree data structures commonly used for indexing in databases.

nodes.label: Hash indices: static and dynamic
nodes.title: Hash indices: static and dynamic: Hash indices use hash functions to map keys to locations in a data structure for efficient retrieval.

nodes.label: Algorithms for query operators
nodes.title: Algorithms for query operators: Query operators include operations like selection, projection, joins, and sorting.

nodes.label: Analysis of algorithm efficiency
nodes.title: Analysis of algorithm efficiency: Analysis of algorithm efficiency involves evaluating the performance of query processing algorithms in terms of time complexity, space complexity, and I/O costs.

nodes.label: Data Structures Introduction
nodes.title: Data Structures Introduction: Data Structures Introduction: Fundamentals of organizing and storing data efficiently.

nodes.label: Searching And Lists
nodes.title: Searching And Lists: Searching And Lists: Techniques for searching data efficiently and organizing data in lists.

nodes.label: Measuring performance
nodes.title: Measuring performance: Measuring performance: Methods for evaluating the efficiency and effectiveness of algorithms and data structures.

nodes.label: Analysing Performance
nodes.title: Analysing Performance: Analysing Performance: Techniques for analyzing the performance of algorithms and data structures under various conditions.

nodes.label: Efficient Sets
nodes.title: Efficient Sets: Efficient Sets: Data structures optimized for efficient storage and retrieval of unique elements.

nodes.label: Better Sets And Maps With Hash Tables
nodes.title: Better Sets And Maps With Hash Tables: Better Sets And Maps With Hash Tables: Data structures utilizing hash tables to achieve efficient insertion, deletion, and retrieval operations for sets and maps.

nodes.label: Balancing A Bst
nodes.title: Balancing A Bst: Process of ensuring that the height of a binary search tree remains balanced to maintain efficient search, insertion, and deletion operations.

nodes.label: Limitations
nodes.title: Limitations: Constraints or drawbacks associated with binary search trees, such as the potential for degeneration into a linear data structure.
